issue.title: Deserialization error when using Object Ids

repository.name: jackson
repository.description: Main Portal page for the Jackson project

issue.body:
I have an interesting error using **version 2.7.0-rc1**: when deserializing the same Class sometimes AbstractDeserializer.deserializeWithType() is called and sometimes BeanDeserializerBase.deserializeWithType() is used. I couldn't figure out the reason. But the problem is that AbstractDeserializer seems to be missing some checks that are done in the BeanDeserializerBase.

```
                // but, with 2.5+, a simple Object-wrapped value also legal:
                if (t == JsonToken.START_OBJECT) {
                    t = p.nextToken();
                }
                if (t == JsonToken.FIELD_NAME && _objectIdReader.maySerializeAsObject()
                        && _objectIdReader.isValidReferencePropertyName(p.getCurrentName(), p)) {
                    return deserializeFromObjectId(p, ctxt);
                }
```

As this check is missing I get the following error message:
**com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException: Unexpected token (END_OBJECT), expected FIELD_NAME: missing property 'level' that is to contain type id  (for class ee.hm.dop.model.taxon.Taxon)**

If the missing code is not the problem, I can provide you further information and test data.

I also reported this problem at JSOG GitHub page, but after a deeper debug seems to me that the problem is with Jackson. You can read my comment there: https://github.com/jsog/jsog-jackson/pull/8#issuecomment-160693413

Full stactrace:

```

    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException.from(JsonMappingException.java:213)

    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.deser.AbstractDeserializer.deserializeWithType(AbstractDeserializer.java:131)
```

issue.title: JSOG and Polymorphic types (again)
issue.body:
I'm not sure if I'm overlooking something or if this actually is a bug somewhere. 

Executing this test results in the following Exception though:

> com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException: Unexpected token (END_OBJECT), expected FIELD_NAME: missing property '@type' that is to contain type id  (for class com.voodoodyne.jackson.jsog.PolymorphicTest2$AbstractClass)
>  at [Source: java.io.ByteArrayInputStream@4cc451f2; line: 1, column: 139](through reference chain: Object[][0]->com.voodoodyne.jackson.jsog.SomeClass["abstractClass"]->com.voodoodyne.jackson.jsog.SubClass["someClasses"]->java.util.ArrayList[1]->com.voodoodyne.jackson.jsog.SomeClass["abstractClass"])

Is there anything I can change about the model here to make this work or is there an actual bug hiding somehwere?

body: I hope this helps -- handling is now identical between cases.
Hi, thanks for the quick fix. How can I test it? I checked out the project but build fails.
@jordanms Fails how? If it's for dependencies (to other snapshot versions), those (just annotations and core) also need to be built locally.

@cowtowncoder Cannot download jackson-parent

```
  <parent>
    <groupId>com.fasterxml.jackson</groupId>
    <artifactId>jackson-parent</artifactId>
    <version>2.7.0-rc2-SNAPSHOT</version>
  </parent>
```

I cloned all the repos: parent, core, annotation and built them locally and now it works. Thanks

I ran my unit tests and the fix works fine. Thanks you again.

This fix is quite important for my project. Do you have a release date for 2.7.0-rc2?
@jordanms Hoping to get rc2 out within a week or so -- want to integrate 2 patches for it.

issue.title: Deserializing JSOG to abstract type
